datasource.description: Enable to include datasource information for each linked object.

count.description: Maximum number of entries to return.

skip_to.description: Skip to Nth CMDB entry. Only collect statistical data after it.

with_meta.description: Enable to include meta information about each object (type id, references, etc).

with_contents_hash.description: Enable to include a checksum of each object's contents.

skip.description: Enable to call CLI skip operator to hide skipped properties.

format.description: List of property names to include in results, separated by | (i.e. policyid|srcintf).

filter.description:
Filtering multiple key/value pairs
Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

key.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this name.

pattern.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this value.

datasource_format.description: A map of datasources to a string of attributes, separated by | (ie: policyid|srcintf). If specified, this will add the attributes listed for any linked objects.

unfiltered_count.description: Maximum number of unfiltered entries to interate through.

stat-items.description: Items to count occurrence in entire response (multiple items should be separated by '|').

primary_keys.description: The primary key to find indexes for.

action.description:
default: Return the CLI default values for entire CLI tree.
meta: Return meta data for a specific object, table, or the entire CLI tree.
json-schema: Return JSON Schema for entire CLI tree.
schema: Return schema for entire CLI tree.

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

action.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_move_: Move this specific resource.
When *action=move* is set, one of the extra parameters (*before*, *after*) must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

before.description:
If *action=move*, use *before* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved before.
For example, to move `object 1` to before `object 2`, use:
__action=move&before=2__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

after.description:
If *action=move*, use *after* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved after.
For example, to move `object 1` to after `object 3`, use:
__action=move&after=3__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

action.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_clone_: Clone this specific resource.
When *action=clone* is set, the extra parameters *nkey* must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

nkey.description:
If *action=clone*, use *nkey* to specify the ID for the new resource to be created.
For example, to clone `address1` to `address1_clone`, use:
__action=clone&nkey=address1_clone__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *clone*.

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

GET.summary:
Select all entries in a CLI table.
 Access Group: fwgrp

POST.summary:
Create object(s) in this table.
 Access Group: fwgrp

PUT.summary:
Update this specific resource.
 Access Group: fwgrp

DELETE.summary:
Delete this specific resource.
 Access Group: fwgrp

type.name: type
type.help: IP pool type: overload, one-to-one, fixed-port-range, port-block-allocation, cgn-resource-allocation (hyperscale vdom only)

options.name: overload
options.help: IP addresses in the IP pool can be shared by clients.
options.label: Overload

startip.name: startip
startip.help: First IPv4 address (inclusive) in the range for the address pool (format xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx, Default: 0.0.0.0).

endip.name: endip
endip.help: Final IPv4 address (inclusive) in the range for the address pool (format xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx, Default: 0.0.0.0).

startport.name: startport
startport.help: First port number (inclusive) in the range for the address pool (1024 - 65535, Default: 5117).

endport.name: endport
endport.help: Final port number (inclusive) in the range for the address pool (1024 - 65535, Default: 65533).

source-startip.name: source-startip
source-startip.help: First IPv4 address (inclusive) in the range of the source addresses to be translated (format = xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx, default = 0.0.0.0).

source-endip.name: source-endip
source-endip.help: Final IPv4 address (inclusive) in the range of the source addresses to be translated (format xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx, Default: 0.0.0.0).

block-size.name: block-size
block-size.help: Number of addresses in a block (64 - 4096, default = 128).

port-per-user.name: port-per-user
port-per-user.help: Number of port for each user (32 - 60416, default = 0, which is auto).

num-blocks-per-user.name: num-blocks-per-user
num-blocks-per-user.help: Number of addresses blocks that can be used by a user (1 to 128, default = 8).

pba-interim-log.name: pba-interim-log
pba-interim-log.help: Port block allocation interim logging interval (600 - 86400 seconds, default = 0 which disables interim logging).

permit-any-host.name: permit-any-host
permit-any-host.help: Enable/disable fullcone NAT. Accept UDP packets from any host.

arp-reply.name: arp-reply
arp-reply.help: Enable/disable replying to ARP requests when an IP Pool is added to a policy (default = enable).

arp-intf.name: arp-intf
arp-intf.help: Select an interface from available options that will reply to ARP requests. (If blank, any is selected).

source-prefix6.name: source-prefix6
source-prefix6.help: Source IPv6 network to be translated (format = xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx/xxx, default = ::/0).

client-prefix-length.name: client-prefix-length
client-prefix-length.help: Subnet length of a single deterministic NAT64 client (1 - 128, default = 64).

tcp-session-quota.name: tcp-session-quota
tcp-session-quota.help: Maximum number of concurrent TCP sessions allowed per client (0 - 2097000, default = 0 which means no limit).

udp-session-quota.name: udp-session-quota
udp-session-quota.help: Maximum number of concurrent UDP sessions allowed per client (0 - 2097000, default = 0 which means no limit).

icmp-session-quota.name: icmp-session-quota
icmp-session-quota.help: Maximum number of concurrent ICMP sessions allowed per client (0 - 2097000, default = 0 which means no limit).

privileged-port-use-pba.name: privileged-port-use-pba
privileged-port-use-pba.help: Enable/disable selection of the external port from the port block allocation for NAT'ing privileged ports (deafult = disable).

options.name: disable
options.help: Select new nat port for privileged source ports from priviliged range 512-1023.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Select new nat port for privileged source ports from priviliged range 512-1023

options.name: enable
options.help: Select new nat port for privileged source ports from client's port block
options.label: Enable
options.description: Select new nat port for privileged source ports from client's port block

subnet-broadcast-in-ippool.name: subnet-broadcast-in-ippool
subnet-broadcast-in-ippool.help: Enable/disable inclusion of the subnetwork address and broadcast IP address in the NAT64 IP pool.

options.name: disable
options.help: Do not include the subnetwork address and broadcast IP address in the NAT64 IP pool.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Do not include the subnetwork address and broadcast IP address in the NAT64 IP pool
